bow: my wife is struggling with being at home with our newborn son and is making family basically slave labor hi everyone to preface our son was born late september and for week after the birth my wife parents were here and she basically treated them as slave labor when went back to work non stop chores and cooking looking after dogs etc and now is trying to do the same thing to my mom when talk with her about it she always says she needs break from the baby but never gets help from the assistance she has had to do so or even much less take nap because she considers herself so busy am supposed to take some time off next week to again help out and already take care of the all the housework cook for us etc am at my wits end with the constant complaining and gratification that she needs it is not possible for me to do everything even though know she has minor discomfort no more than any other first time mom work full time am up at all feedings time during the night including diaper changes do the housework cook meals and still get the talk that am not doing enough in addition my mom is thinking about leaving for home early as she is so frustrated not being able to take some time with her grandson does anyone have advice that has been similar situation as am in desperate need to try and make things better not only for myself but my wife as well thanks reddit is this relatively normal behaviour for her mean was she little high maintenance before baby could she be experiencing postpartum depression and not realizing it are there some new mommy groups she could get out to to speak to other new moms it only been few weeks becoming mom is such major transition maybe give her little longer to ease into things in the meanwhile would it be possible to hire something like merry maids to come once or twice no it is not normal behavior for her she would make dinner basically all the time help me with chores etc and was usually upbeat that has definitely trended downwards from being months pregnant when she would no longer go out with to me functions movies entertainment realized she was not dealing with being pregnant as well as other first time pregnancies when we went to classes and others were functioning much more once the family leaves our house cleaning service will be coming once every two weeks again as it used to agree she may need more time but it difficult and want to try and make things better for her aside from the physical adjustments that have to be made after introducing baby into the world both in terms of her body and her surroundings the hormonal changes that women experience after delivery are drastic there could be chance that she is suffering from post partum depression here link with some symptoms which sound like some of the issues your wife has been having http www babycenter com postpartum depression and anxiety 227 bc know it may be difficult because you feel like your wife is sloughing her responsibility off on you and your family but try to be as supportive as you can if you think that there may be some likelihood that her issues are related to ppd have her talk to her obgyn or her gp to figure out what steps she can take to help would for sure see her obgyn or doctor my spouse was given sort of things to look for list by the nurses after had my first postpartum depression or anxiety can come in many forms for myself it did hit until had my second child and was more anxiety than depression but felt it changing the way thought about lot of things check into it for sure she is going to the dr again on friday and will be unable to attend however know she feels she is just normal and would put on different face at the doctor so doubt she would ever bring it up she may have postpartum depression but she also may just be dealing with the overwhelming feeling that she is responsible for keeping another human alive 24 hours per day with my first son the most exhausting part for me was the knowledge that it does end knew this before had baby but did really know it the other thing that think is really insane for first time moms is that no one ever really lets you know that life will feel normal in few months so that beginning feeling of have to keep this kid alive always feel like crying ca remember my old life just assumed that was forever did have family support just my husband so did delegate but if had had parents or in laws not going to lie with that first kid would have probably tossed him to the first adult who was willing with my subsequent children ve had no problem because know all of that physical mental social and emotional chaos is temporary would recommend mom group but also do think even mom groups really delve into what some first time moms need to hear which is this totally sucks and if continued to suck this bad forever no one would do it second time everything is going to seem better normal and happy in few months know you can not imagine that that true but it really will happen also some people do even like their babies at first and they still later form all the bonds and love they re supposed to feel do worry just get through the day you have forgotten what normal feels like it coming back soon and get meds if needed meds sleep showers and conversation with other adults this needs to be higher up had severe ppd after my first was born denied it for year and it damn near broke my family finally went on medication and started seeing therapist and it was like night and day had similar issues went to therapy got on some medication and evened out quite bit my son father was not supportive in any way however and it led to the demise of our relationship rather than accepting that what was dealing with was legitimate issue he blamed me for being lazy and became increasingly abusive over the following year knew by my son first birthday that was going to have to get out of the relationship and that only exacerbated my issues it too bad that people ca acknowledge mental illness in the same way they do physical illness unfortunately when it comes to ppd it something men will never be able to fully understand you have baby that is not even month old did your wife have vaginal delivery or section people who come to help with the baby after delivery *should* be helping they should be doing things around the house cleaning cooking and allowing your wife to rest and recover even if she did not have surgery she still went through lot medically and physically speaking your mom may have come to visit and spend time with her grandson but that is not what your wife needs and that not what the baby needs your wife should be allowed to bond with her own child above your mother the baby needs your wife and your wife only right now what do you expect your wife to do hand off her brand new baby to someone else so that she can cook and clean and do chores if your wife nursing or bottle feeding taking care of newborn is very very hard cut your wife some slack and maybe do side with your mom on this one if she came by just to get baby cuddles that not what new mom needs this sounds very much like postpartum depression plus some depression during the pregnancy was the exact same way you have to sit her down and talk with her without getting frustrated which will be very difficult my husband had the same issue with me and reasoning with me was extremely hard for him because was legitimately being unreasonable postpartum depression is more common than one would think shes got lot going on with hormones caring for the baby sore breasts sore vagina and just being attached to little human all day that ca survive without you it overwhelming to say the least before you talk to her set up game plan instead of saying am upset that am doing this this and immediately going into what is wrong with her try it from this angle say am worried about you are you ok do you want to talk about it if she says she is fine go with no you re not you are not smiling your crying lot you are disinterested in activities and quite frankly your being extremely mean to everyone around you not mad am genuinely worried about you because this is normal think you need to talk to your ob about postpartum depression or me about it am here for you love you and want to support you but you are making me feel inadequate and hurting my feelings lot too know that you are struggling am too and want to work on this with you so that we are on the same page need you too let her know you are hurting and you understand that shes got lot going on but that you need her just as much as she needs you too lt lt hope she gets some help postpartum depression is honestly the worst and can present itself in lot of different ways knew enough was enough when was laying in the bathtub crying while my son was screaming in the other room and my husband came in and said you need to call your doctor hey totally agree and thanks for the comment for the record have told my mom what she needs to be doing to help out if she does like it well she can leave and she can think about it for several months my wife had vaginal delivery and is breast feeding am cutting her lots of slack hence me doing as much as possibly can by doing chores cooking cleaning being up at night etc it could be ppd but it can also take good weeks to recover physically emotionally and hormonal from pregnancy also if someone is visiting and staying with you after you have baby they should help out around the house so the mother and baby can be together they are not slave labor they are helping new mom recover from pregnancy and birth so unless your wife asked rudely or never said thank you see no problem with expecting them to help this is going to be hard for both of you keeping tiny human alive is exhausting new moms need support their body literally squeezed watermelon through lemon sized hole sorry that happened to you hopefully you re in better healthier happier place now currently pregnant with number and terrified of the ppd coming back but feel better prepared with what to look for and wo wait year before getting help your wife may have postpartum mood disorder so hope she seeing her gyn regularly gyns and midwives can spot this stuff even if the mom tries to hide it but your wife still needs to be as honest as possible also recommend couples therapy for the two of you this is major change to your relationship and it time when resentment can really build if your wife is feeling paranoid then she may already resent her situation but even if she not she may have very set ideas for how things should be at this time and wants everyone else to tow the line as for the recovery had normal birth and felt like been hit by train physically emotionally and mentally was basically crazy nothing did or said made any sense be aware that the person you re talking to may not be able to see things rationally at all strongly suggest not telling her this so that line of argument wo work for you afraid it all about compassion time and getting her the help she needs if your baby was born late september then baby is no more than or weeks old right is your wife breastfeeding asking grandparents who come visit so soon after baby is born to do basic chores make meals and take care of pets is slave labor in my opinion that absolutely what people who come to visit should be doing especially if mom is breastfeeding what did they expect to be doing during these visits also noticed that you seemed to brush off her physical recovery as minor discomfort that is just like every other mom this does mean it is easy she has had months of physical toll on her body as she has grown another human culminating in an extremely physically taxing event birth followed by insane postpartum hormones and her body is now working extra hard to literally provide the nourishment to keep another human alive regardless of how normal her experience is this is all very very exhausting get it you are exhausted too you feel like you are doing everything because you are you are doing everything you possibly can but honestly from your post it sounds like you have little empathy for your wife situation and believe she is doing everything she can too it is very common after birth for each parent to believe they are doing it all and that their partner is pulling their weight the reality is that you are both giving 150 and it still not enough to do everything you did before you brought this tiny human home my suggestion is to find some empathy for your wife have conversation with her about how you re both doing your best and you both need to appreciate the other and let some things go the older baby gets the easier things will become you re only weeks into this it sounds like what you and your wife both need is little more empathy and willingness to cut each other some slack it been years ve been great my son is great hope is better for you good luck if could make one suggestion do not compare what she going through with what others may or may not be going through see you do it few times realized she was not dealing with being pregnant as well as other first time pregnancies and even though know she has minor discomfort no more than any other first time mom what she going through is very real and legitimate to her even if her reaction seems drastic to you that does change the fact that she perceives it certain way yes it does sound like she struggling and that ppd is likely factor but talking about it in this way is damaging slipped into ppd and it made things hard regular ordinary everyday things until my husband understood that maybe there was an issue bigger than just baby blues he would come at me with all these should and other people and it made me feel even worse as side note also you have no idea what other people are going through behind closed doors so to assume that other people fare better and that you wife should be reacting xyz way you just do know enough to say that try to be understanding of what she going through yet firm in suggesting that she might benefit from some therapy and or help but leave the comparisons out of it thanks glad you are doing well think the being first time mom is poor excuse it right on up there with pms ing and pregnant first time mom had my baby in the middle of july there ended up being complication he pooped in the womb and ended up getting section yet still got up for feedings nursing so had too for diaper changes did the laundry caring for the dog and sugar glider cooking and cleaning shopping etc sure the surgery made it hurt little but still did what needed to be done still had time to sleep nap still had time to bond with the baby and still let other bond with him as well just started working full time again so now having little bit of help form the father is very much appreciated caring for newborn and doing everyday tasks is not as hard as what everyone tries to make it seem or maybe it is and just that it been super easy for thank you for the comment and totally agree that we could cut each other some more slack to help out my post may have come off little disingenuous in regards to her pain but do sympathize and make sure she is taking her medication regularly and trying to recover to back to some normal state that makes her happy thank you and agree that we should not be comparing but those comparisons came from her and her talking with few other friends she has that recently gave birth want to be as supportive as possible and would never compare her to someone else because know do know exactly what she is going through and could make things much worse that is great to hear and am very happy for you if were to ever mention this am sure she would have freak out that even would bring up such thing hope you can show her little patience to assume she has no more discomfort than any other new mom is incorrect have given birth times and each one has had different recovery give her time and support it very difficult transition for anyone and am personally glad she is assertive enough to ask for go home because your wife is going to be playing host as for you great job on stepping up and being supportive by doing extra housework and getting up at night try to remember that you re both quite worn out and very very tired see some people suggest ppd but think it very normal after weeks to feel not ok at all for me personally always feel ok never get sick when the rest is but after labor
